title: How to Know Your Spanx Size

steps.title: Wrap a measuring tape around the narrowest part of your waist.
steps.content: Wrap a measuring tape around the narrowest part of your waist. Don't pull or tighten the tape, or you'll get an inaccurate measurement. Write down your waist measurement and find where it falls in the Spanx sizing. Then, wrap the tape around the widest part of your hips. [1] X Expert Source Andrea Beaulieu Professional Tailor & Fashion Designer Expert Interview. 8 May 2020. Here are just a few of their leggings and panties sizes: [2] X Research source Small: 27 to 30 1 ⁄ 2 in (69 to 77 cm) waist and {{convert|35|to|37+1/2|in|cm|abbr=on} hips Medium: 31 to 33 in (79 to 84 cm) waist and 38 to 40 1 ⁄ 2 in (97 to 103 cm) hips Large: 33 1 ⁄ 2 to 35 1 ⁄ 2 in (85 to 90 cm) waist and 41 to 43 in (100 to 110 cm) hips Extra-large: 36 to 39 in (91 to 99 cm) waist and 43 1 ⁄ 2 to 45 1 ⁄ 2 in (110 to 116 cm) hips

steps.title: Spanx sizes their hosiery with letters A through G.
steps.content: Spanx sizes their hosiery with letters A through G. To learn your size, find the letter that covers your height and weight. This way, the hosiery won't feel like it's too short, which can pull on your torso. [3] X Research source For example, if you're between 5 and 6 ft (1.5 and 1.8 m) tall and you weigh between 165 and 220 pounds (75 and 100 kg), you'd be a size G according to the Spanx hosiery chart.

steps.title: Wear a lightly-lined bra that fits you well and wrap the tape around your chest.
steps.content: Wear a lightly-lined bra that fits you well and wrap the tape around your chest. Bring the tape around your back and under your armpits so it meets high on your chest. Write down this measurement—it's your band size. Then, wrap the band around the widest part of your bust. Subtract this measurement and use the difference to find your cup size. [4] X Research source If your band size is an odd number, just round up to the nearest even number. For instance, if you measure 37 inches (94 cm), your band size is a 38. For example, if your band size measures 36 inches (91 cm) and your bust size measures 40 inches (100 cm), your Spanx bra size is a 36D.

steps.title: Wrap a measuring tape around the narrowest part of your waist.
steps.content: Wrap a measuring tape around the narrowest part of your waist. Then, measure around the widest part of your chest to get your bust measurement. You can use both of these measurements to find the closest fit. If you're in between two sizes, go for the larger size so the top is sure to fit. [5] X Research source You don't usually need your hip measurement for most Spanx tops since they're loose around the waist.

steps.title: You can use your usual size for some products like tops, panties, and leggings.
steps.content: You can use your usual size for some products like tops, panties, and leggings. If you're in a hurry, you might not have time to pull out a measuring tape and find your exact measurements. Don't worry! Several Spanx products have standard sizing that you can use if you don't know things like your waist or bust size. For example, you can buy a Spanx top in small if you usually wear a small, or get large leggings if you usually wear a size large in pants.

steps.title: If you're shopping online, click "Find Your Size" on a product page.
steps.content: If you're shopping online, click "Find Your Size" on a product page. This takes you right to the specific measurements for that item. [6] X Expert Source Andrea Beaulieu Professional Tailor & Fashion Designer Expert Interview. 8 May 2020. Sometimes, a product listing will also tell you how reviewers say it fits. [7] X Research source You may see a sliding scale that says, "runs small," "true to size, and, "runs large." If you see that a product usually runs large, you may want to consider getting a smaller size. [8] X Expert Source Andrea Beaulieu Professional Tailor & Fashion Designer Expert Interview. 8 May 2020.

steps.title: Search the Power Series Collection for the most flexibility.
steps.content: Search the Power Series Collection for the most flexibility. Spanx recommends that you use seamless shapewear if your measurements fall between 2 different sizes. Once you find a product, like a bodysuit, use your larger measurement to pick the size. [9] X Research source For instance, if you have a size medium waist measurements, but size large hip measurements, choose a large size for the shapewear.

steps.title: Don't automatically reach for a smaller size if you want snug Spanx.
steps.content: Don't automatically reach for a smaller size if you want snug Spanx. Level 1 compression gives a slight fit while Level 2 offers a little more shaping. For the tightest fit, try Level 3 compression which sculpts. This means that it can help lift your breasts or slim your tummy, for instance. If you're shopping online, use the search filters to select which level of compression you want.

steps.title: Spanx should be snug without riding up.
steps.content: Spanx should be snug without riding up. If you see skin bulging to the sides, or the Spanx ride up or down, you need to go up a size. You'll probably find that a slightly bigger size feels more comfortable, and the fit is better.
